intro: Trymalium expansum, commonly known as the broadleaf trymalium, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. The species is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in heathlands and open forests.
